actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to restrict the disclosure of information in the possession of telephone companies or telegraph companies concerning members of the news media.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Newsmen's Right to Privacy Act - Provides that it shall be unlawful for any telephone company or telegraph company to disclose information with respect to any member of the news media without a court order issued upon the finding that the disclosure of such information (1) will not reveal or threaten to reveal the identity of any source of information with respect to the member of the news media involved in such action; or (2) will serve a compelling and overriding national interest. Sets forth penalties for violation of the provisions of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to restrict the disclosure of information in the possession of telephone companies or telegraph companies concerning members of the news media.
